qas.question: The imperial system Napoleon created was based on what model?
What did Napoleon use to justify his creation of an imperial system?
Napoleon wrote his family's succession into the constitution in an attempt to prevent the restoration of what former ruling family?
Napoleon was elected Emperor of the French by more than what percentage of voters?
About how many voters participated in the election that made Napoleon Emperor of the French?

context: To expand his power, Napoleon used these <a1_0>assassination plots<a1_0/> to justify the creation of an imperial system based on <a0_0>the Roman<a0_0/> model. He believed that a <a2_0>Bourbon<a2_0/> restoration would be more difficult if his family's succession was entrenched in the constitution. Launching yet another referendum, Napoleon was elected as Emperor of the French by a tally exceeding <a3_0>99%<a3_0/>. As with the Life Consulate two years earlier, this referendum produced heavy participation, bringing out almost <a4_0>3.6 million<a4_0/> voters to the polls.
